Class SegmentMatcher

java.lang.Object
  com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.boundarymatch.SegmentMatcher
public class SegmentMatcher
extends java.lang.Object

A SegmentMatcher computes information about whether two boundary LineSegments match

isMatch

public boolean isMatch(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment seg1,
                       com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment seg2)
Computes whether two segments match. This matching algorithm uses the following conditions to determine if two line segments match:
  • The segments have similar slope. I.e., the difference in slope between the two segments is less than the angle tolerance (this test is made irrespective of orientation)
  • The segments have a mutual overlap (e.g. they both have a non-null projection on the other)
  • The Hausdorff distance between the mutual projections of the segments is less than the distance tolerance. This ensures that matched segments are close along their entire length.

This relation is symmetrical.

Parameters:
seg1 -
seg2 -
Returns:
true if the segments match

hasMutualOverlap

public boolean hasMutualOverlap(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment src,
                                com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment tgt)
Test whether there is an overlap between the segments in either direction. A segment overlaps another if it projects onto the segment.

projectsOnto
